revised_title: Improvements to Hadley's Quadrant for Enhanced Nautical Navigation
tldr: Peter Dollond describes his improvements to Hadley's quadrant, a crucial nautical instrument, to enhance its accuracy and usability at sea. He explains his methods for adjusting the glasses and creating a more stable index glass frame. Dollond also shares his use of darkening glasses to improve visibility during observations. These enhancements aim to increase the precision of celestial observations and extend the use of the instrument for determining longitude at sea.
